etymology.description: 春 (spring) + 节/節 (festival; seasonal node) = Spring Festival.
etymology.interpretation: Names the Lunar New Year period and the start-of-spring season in the traditional calendar. By extension, refers to the most important annual holiday in the Sinosphere.
etymology.simplification: Only 節 was simplified: 節 → 节, an abbreviated, fewer-stroke form (dropping the bamboo radical and compressing the phonetic) to ease writing while preserving sound and core senses like “festival/section.”

examples.chinese: 我们在春节回家团圆(我們在春節回家團圓)。
examples.english: We go home to reunite at Spring Festival.

examples.chinese: 春节期间(春節期間)，街上张灯结彩(街上張燈結彩)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié qījiān, jiē shang zhāng dēng jié cǎi.
examples.english: During Spring Festival, the streets are brightly decorated.

examples.chinese: 许多公司在春节放假一周(許多公司在春節放假一週)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō gōngsī zài Chūnjié fàngjià yì zhōu.
examples.english: Many companies take a week off for Spring Festival.
